title: Girl banned from school dance for wearing jumpsuit instead of dress
text:
Darcy Krueger was banned from a homecoming dance for homeschooled students because she was wearing a jumpsuit (Picture: Jennie Ellis Photography/Facebook/ Fox 8)

A teenage girl was turned away from a school dance for wearing a jumpsuit instead of a dress.

Darcy Krueger, 17, said she was unable to find the perfect dress for the Tampa Bay Homeschool homecoming dance on September 27.

However she came up with a solution. She already had a black jumpsuit that she thought would be perfect. So she decided to dress it up with rhinestone shoes, a necklace, and a new hairstyle and wear it to the dance.

But when she arrived to the dance, which was for home-schooled students in Tampa Bay, Florida, the event planner stopped her before she even entered.

Darcy, who paid $50 for the ticket to the dance, told Fox 8: ‘The first moment (the event planner) sees my pants, she completely dismisses me.’ My friends are kind of in disbelief too, and they’re like, “This is wrong.”‘

She called her mother, Melissa, who was shocked to learn that her daughter was not allowed into the dance.

Melissa Krueger said: ‘I knew the dress code, but it didn’t occur to me that it was going to be a problem,’ adding that she knew the dress code did not allow pants, but she assumed the emphasis to assure ‘coverage of all the lady bits.’

The event organizer, Stephanie Voth, sent CNN a dress code that said the requirement was ‘semi-formal dresses for young ladies.’

Strapless, knee-length, and two piece dresses were all allowed and some attendees were wearing outfits that pushed the conservative dress code, Melissa Krueger said, hitting out at the event for forcing girls to wear dresses.

‘We weren’t trying to bend the rules or break them,’ she said.

‘The bigger question is, why can’t a girl wear something other than a dress code? This isn’t “Little House on the Prairie.”‘
description: Darcy Krueger, 17, was turned away from the Tampa Bay Homeschool homecoming dance for wearing a jumpsuit instead of a dress.
